availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Cornelius T. Dabney (Princeton, Caldwell County, Kentucky, saddler)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, saddler. Louisa County, Virginia, native. Married to Mariah Louisa Wylie Dabney in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on January 11, 1844. Father of Francis W. Dabney, Charles C Dabney, Albert M. Dabney, John Dabney, Cornelius Sidney Dabney Richard Dabney, David Dabney, Mary Dabney, and E. Dabney. Saddler in Caldwell County in 1850. Employed Caleb A. Baldwin as a saddler in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Saddler in Princeton in 1860. Employed John Cody as a harness maker in Princeton in 1860. Employed James Keddy as a buggy trimmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 1, p. 816.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 218A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 512A.
